clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Long Term Cocoa Flavanol Intake on Blood Pressure and Platelet Function in Healthy Adults, Part 1
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Long Term Cocoa Flavanol Intake on Blood Pressure and Platelet Function in Healthy Adults, Part 1

brief_summary.textblock: Flavanols are plant-derived compounds commonly present in the human diet. Examples of flavanol-containing foods and beverages are apples, chocolate, tea, wine, berries, pomegranate and nuts. The consumption of flavanol-containing foods and beverages has been associated with improvements in cardiovascular health. In this study, the investigators hope to learn more about the effects of the consumption of increasing amounts of cocoa flavanols on blood pressure, platelet function and other metabolic parameters in healthy humans. This study was followed by a second study that aimed at investigating the effects of long term consumptions of cocoa flavanols on blood pressure, platelet function and other metabolic parameters in healthy humans.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (day 0) and 14, 28, 42 and 56 days after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Blood pressure will be measured using standard techniques.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and 14, 28, 42 and 56 days after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Platelet function will be determined using the PFA-100® analyzer (Dade Behring International, Miami, FL) with collagen-epinephrine (CEPI)- and collagen-ADP (CADP) stimulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in metabolic parameters in blood
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (day 0) and 14, 28, 42 and 56 days after intervention
primary_outcome.description: Metabolic parameters determined in blood included: comprehensive metabolic panel, liver panel and cell blood counting.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma concentration of cocoa flavanol metabolites
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (day 0) and 14, 28, 42 and 56 days after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Cocoa flavanol metabolites in plasma include: structurally related (-)-epicatechin metabolites and 5-(3,4-dihydroxyphenyl)-4-valerolactone metabolites

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in plasma concentration of methylxanthines
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (day 0) and 14, 28, 42 and 56 days after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Methylxanthines determined in plasma include: caffeine, theobromine, paraxanthine and theophylline

arm_group.description: Ingestion of increasing number of capsules containing Mars Cocoa Extract manufactured by the Cocoapro® process (500 mg of cocoa flavanols/capsule) during 6 weeks followed by a 2 week of washout (no capsule intake)

intervention.description: Capsules containing Mars Cocoa Extract manufactured by the Cocoapro® process, providing 500 mg of cocoa flavanols per capsule: 1000 mg of cocoa flavanols consumed daily during week 1 and 2, 1500 mg of cocoa flavanols consumed daily during week 3 and 4, and 2000 mg of cocoa flavanols consumed daily during week 5 and 6, and no capsule consumed (washout) during week 7 and 8.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 30-55 years old
- A normal blood chemistry and liver function
- BMI < 30 kg/m2
- previously consumed cocoa and peanut products, with no adverse reactions
Exclusion Criteria:
- A history of cardiovascular disease, stroke, hypertension, renal, hepatic, or thyroid disease, GI tract disorders, previous GI surgery, metabolic syndrome, diabetes, taking cholesterol-lowering medication, hormone replacement therapy, antioxidant supplements, on aspirin therapy or taking anticoagulants, or on a medically prescribed diet.
- Allergies to nuts, cocoa and chocolate products
- Vegetarian, Vegan, food faddists, individuals using non-traditional diets, on a weight loss diet or using herbal dietary supplements
